Unfortunately, Riot has been steadily going into the "having your cake and eating it too" idea of game design. More and more decisions regarding itemization have been in the realm of handing out free damage or free defense on the kinds of items a certain class already has to build in order to do their job at all. In the case of AD Carries, it's free survivability. To top this off, they appear to want to balance champions by introducing clunkiness to their kit rather than stripping extraneous power. Delayed damage on assassins is the most recent application of this.

Riot seems to want a champion to be a closed system where they bring everything they need (or can at least buy what they need). Needing to use teammates is "unfun" apparently, despite this being a team game. The only time they relent on this angle is when designing a support, and it's often to the support's detriment as well.

Jesus, you guys make it sound like adc's just draintank the entire team, if an adc gets focused, hit by a full mage combo, jumped on by a tank or a melee carry, adc dies. ADC's typically will only survive if they get grazed or focused halfway, at which point they can lifesteal health back. Rot has said that the entire point of lifesteal is to force people to primary adc's or they will survive the entire fight.

Mid game, a bruiser or mage or assassin should be able to solo hop on the enemy adc and pop them or force them to leave the fight for good regardless of peeling the enemy team tries; you get to them, they die or have to run for their lives the whole fight. But now it takes 2 people just to do this. Probably 3 people or 2 fed people to ensure they die asap, or the adc escapes and drain tanks. And they have too much mobility from items too considering basically every tank item only gives initial engage - leaving tanks and bruisers with nothing to catch an adc after they survive the initial engage onto them - which thanks to support items and exhaust and cc they pretty much guaranteed do. And late game? Not a damn chance unless you got 3 people diving and deleting the adc - not likely considering the tendency of teams to pick ranged dps or burst champs. You can't just pop a syndra or ori ult to open the fight then flash on the adc with vi ult or renekton combo and pop them. If you do that - even if you could manage to pull it off - you wouldn't kill the adc, they'd just kite back, and you get deleted by the enemy team while the adc drain tanks. That is the stupidity of how absurdly overtuned adc's are due to nerfs to other classes' damage items and due to survivability of adc's due to support items.
You want proof beyond that? If one team has an average adc or slightly sub par adc but their top and mid are amazing... the enemy team has average or sub par top and mid but amazing adc, the adc advantage outweighs the top and mid advantage every time. Last time I checked, 2>1. But not in league; adc>all. This is why people are so damn fed up with adc's and items buffing/protecting adc's. Hell I've skipped out on building {{item:3143}} vs 2 fed crit users on the enemy team because {{item:3109}} made me tankier thanks to bs healing from my adc doing damage. The protection for adc's needs to be cut down massively and some raw damage (ad and ap) stats be given back to items for other classes like mages, assassins, and bruisers or their ability scaling numbers increased (so you get the same effect). After this is properly taken care of, then we can assess which if any adc's are truly in need of nerfs and which ones are only overtuned due to the insane level of survivability given to them by supportive tank, heal, and shield items of which they make better use than any other class of champion.

It isn't a role, where getting caught out means standing still, two shotting and overhealing through all the damage you receive. That is no risk, and simply unacceptable.

It isn't a matter of "want", rather, it is more a case of "can't". If ADCs are expected to have the DPS necessary to work down tanks and towers as quickly as possible, then defense must be sacrificed, with the understanding that team would generally defend them for the most part. If they build even a single defensive item, then their DPS goes down the crapper in comparison to the ADC that went whole hog on the damage.

Assassins on the other hand take the following risks: getting past the enemy front line defenders, dodging CC from the tanks and supports, and bursting the ADC fast enough before the ADC can use its DPS on the assassin.

The case can also be said that assassin mains don't want to build defensive items as well, to instead maximize their almighty burst._ Why would assassins build glasscannon when the enemy ADC is fed/has a competent front line._
